member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.AlignedArray
member.summary:
This implements a logical array of floats that is automatically aligned for SSE/AVX operations. To pin and force alignment, call the GetPin method, typically wrapped in a using (since it returns a Pin struct that is IDisposable). From the pin, you can get the IntPtr to pass to native code.
The ctor takes an alignment value, which must be a power of two at least sizeof(float).

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.AlignedArray.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Allocate an aligned vector with the given alignment (in bytes). The alignment must be a power of two and at least sizeof(Float).

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.CpuAlignedVector
member.summary: This implements a logical array of Floats that is automatically aligned for SSE/AVX operations. This is a thin wrapper around the AlignedArray type implemented in C++. This simply couples the AlignedArray with a logical size, which does not include padding, while the AlignedArray size does include padding.

member.summary: The value count.

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.CpuAlignedVector.VectorSize
member.summary: The logical size of the vector.

member.summary: Allocate an aligned vector with the given alignment (in bytes). The alignment must be a power of two and at least sizeof(Float).

member.summary: The physical AligenedArray items.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.CpuAligenedMathUtils`1.AssertCompatible(Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.ICpuVector)
member.summary: Assert the compatibility of the underlying AlignedArray for the input vector in terms of alignment amount.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.CpuAligenedMathUtils`1.AssertCompatible(Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.ICpuFullMatrix,Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.ICpuVector,Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.ICpuVector)
member.summary: Asserts the following: 1. The compatibility of the underlying AlignedArray for mat in terms of alignment amount. 2. The compatibility of the underlying AlignedArray for src in terms of alignment amount. 3. The compatibility of the underlying AlignedArray for dst in terms of alignment amount. 4. The compatibility of the matrix-vector multiplication mat * src = dst.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.ProbabilityFunctions.Probit(System.Double)
member.summary: The probit function. This has many applications, the most familiar being perhaps that this is the point "x" at which the standard normal CDF evaluates to the indicated p value. It is used in establishing confidence intervals.
member.param: The input p value, so in the range 0 to 1.
member.returns: One interpretation is, the value at which the standard normal CDF evaluates to p.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.Core.IExceptionContext
member.summary: Interface for "processing" exceptions before they are thrown. This can be used to add context to the exception, wrap the exception in another one, totally replace the exception, etc. It is not legal to return null from Process (unless null was passed in, which really shouldn't happen).

member.name: P:Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.Core.IExceptionContext.ContextDescription
member.summary: A string describing the context itself.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.Core.Contracts.Process``1(``0,Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.Core.IExceptionContext)
member.summary: Does standard processing of an exception (typically called after construction but before it is thrown).

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.Core.Contracts.Mark``1(``0)
member.summary: Mark the exception by setting in the exception to 1.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.Core.Contracts.IsMarked(System.Exception)
member.summary: Indicates whether the exception was "marked" the Contracts code.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.Core.Contracts.MarkSensitive``1(``0,Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.Core.MessageSensitivity)
member.summary: Exceptions whose message communicates potentially sensitive information should be marked using this method, before they are thrown. Note that if the exception already had this flag set, the message will be flagged with the bitwise or of the existing flag, alongside the passed in sensitivity.

member.name: M:Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.Core.Contracts.Sensitivity(System.Exception)
member.summary: This is a convenience method to get the sensitivity of an exception, as encoded with . If there is no key, then the message is assumed to be of unknown sensitivity, i.e., it is assumed that it might contain literally anything.
member.returns: The value encoded at the , if it is a value. If neither of these conditions hold then is returned.

member.summary: Sets the assert handler to the given function, returning the previous handler.

member.summary: CheckUserArg / ExceptUserArg should be used when the validation of user-provided arguments failed. Typically, this is shortly after the arguments are parsed using CmdParser.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.Core.BestFriendAttribute
member.summary: Intended to be applied to types and members with internal scope to indicate that friend access of this internal item is OK from another assembly. This restriction applies only to assemblies that declare the assembly level attribute. Note that this attribute is not transferable: an internal member with this attribute does not somehow make a containing internal type accessible. Conversely, neither does marking an internal type make any unmarked internal members accessible.

member.name: T:Microsoft.ML.Internal.CpuMath.Core.WantsToBeBestFriendsAttribute
member.summary: This is an assembly level attribute to signal that friend accesses on this assembly should be checked for usage of . If this attribute is missing, normal access rules for friends should apply.
